command: [Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol=[Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12; $ts=Get-Date -Format o; try { $headers=@{ 'Authorization'="Bearer $env:CLEARBIT_API_KEY"; 'Accept'='application/json' }; $r=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri 'https://company.clearbit.com/v2/companies/find?domain=contoso.com' -Headers $headers -Method Get -ErrorAction Stop; ($r.Content | ConvertFrom-Json | Select-Object name,domain,metrics,site,category | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6) | Out-File -FilePath "$env:TEMP\clearbit_company_contoso.json" -Encoding utf8; Add-Content -Path "$env:TEMP\recon.log" -Value "$ts Clearbit success contoso.com" } catch { Add-Content -Path "$env:TEMP\recon.log" -Value "$ts Clearbit error: $($_.Exception.Message)" }
explanation: Queries Clearbit's paid company enrichment API to gather company profile details for the target domain using Bearer token authentication and stores structured results.
rationale_steps: Use Bearer token to access a closed data broker API.
Filter to relevant business attributes and save JSON.
Log the success or failure without exposing the token.
